laboratory_examinations.date: At the time of ERT introduction (age 38) to levels indicating end-stage renal failure
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Declined to levels indicating end-stage renal failure

laboratory_examinations.findings: HDS-R scores: 6, 4, and 4 points; MMSE scores: 15, 17, and 10 points
Lamellated myelin-like inclusions in the cytoplasm of glomerular and tubular cells
At age 42, revealed multiple asymptomatic brain infarctions; at age 48, demonstrated new infarctions at the left pons and bilateral cerebral cortex.
Remarkable declines in Orientation, Language (Comprehension, Naming), Construction, Memory, Calculations and Reasoning, with relatively good scores for Attention and Language Repetition.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Voxel-based Specific Regional Analysis System for Alzheimer's Disease
laboratory_examinations.findings: Z-score of 0.49, indicating no specific loss of gray matter selectivity in bilateral hippocampal regions. Whole brain gray matter volume reduced by 6.02%.
